summary.para: Event IDs for in-memory events that correspond to messages logged to an and events sent to a .
These IDs are also used with to configure the behavior of warnings.
A transaction operation was requested, but ignored because in-memory does not support transactions.
This event is in the category.
This event uses the payload when used with a .
Changes were saved to the database.
This event is in the category.
This event uses the payload when used with a .

member.name: T:Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.InMemoryDatabaseFacadeExtensions
member.summary: In-memory specific extension methods for .

member.name: M:Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.InMemoryDatabaseFacadeExtensions.IsInMemory(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.DatabaseFacade)

summary.para: Returns true if the database provider currently in use is the in-memory provider.

This method can only be used after the has been configured because it is only then that the provider is known. This means that this method cannot be used in because this is where application code sets the provider to use as part of configuring the context.

member.param: The facade from .
member.returns: True if the in-memory database is being used; false otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.InMemoryDbContextOptionsExtensions
member.summary: In-memory specific extension methods for .

member.name: M:Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.InMemoryDbContextOptionsExtensions.UseInMemoryDatabase``1(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder{``0},System.String,System.Action{Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.InMemoryDbContextOptionsBuilder})
member.summary:
Configures the context to connect to an in-memory database. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used, but only for a given service provider. To use the same in-memory database across service providers, call
passing a shared on which to root the database.
member.typeparam: The type of context being configured.
member.param: The builder being used to configure the context.
The name of the in-memory database. This allows the scope of the in-memory database to be controlled independently of the context. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used.
An optional action to allow additional in-memory specific configuration.
member.returns: The options builder so that further configuration can be chained.

member.name: M:Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.InMemoryDbContextOptionsExtensions.UseInMemoryDatabase(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder,System.String,System.Action{Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.InMemoryDbContextOptionsBuilder})
member.summary:
Configures the context to connect to a named in-memory database. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used, but only for a given service provider. To use the same in-memory database across service providers, call
passing a shared on which to root the database.
member.param: The builder being used to configure the context.
The name of the in-memory database. This allows the scope of the in-memory database to be controlled independently of the context. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used.
An optional action to allow additional in-memory specific configuration.
member.returns: The options builder so that further configuration can be chained.

member.summary: Configures the context to connect to an in-memory database. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used, but only for a given service provider.
member.typeparam: The type of context being configured.
member.param: The builder being used to configure the context.
The name of the in-memory database. This allows the scope of the in-memory database to be controlled independently of the context. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used.

All in-memory databases will be rooted in this object, allowing the application to control their lifetime. This is useful when sometimes the context instance is created explicitly with new while at other times it is resolved using dependency injection.
An optional action to allow additional in-memory specific configuration.
member.returns: The options builder so that further configuration can be chained.

member.summary: Configures the context to connect to a named in-memory database. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used, but only for a given service provider.
member.param: The builder being used to configure the context.
The name of the in-memory database. This allows the scope of the in-memory database to be controlled independently of the context. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used.

All in-memory databases will be rooted in this object, allowing the application to control their lifetime. This is useful when sometimes the context instance is created explicitly with new while at other times it is resolved using dependency injection.
An optional action to allow additional in-memory specific configuration.
member.returns: The options builder so that further configuration can be chained.

member.name: M:Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.InMemoryDbContextOptionsExtensions.UseInMemoryDatabase``1(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder{``0},System.Action{Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.InMemoryDbContextOptionsBuilder})
member.summary: Configures the context to connect to the legacy shared in-memory database. This method is obsolete. Use instead.
member.typeparam: The type of context being configured.
member.param: The builder being used to configure the context.
An optional action to allow additional in-memory specific configuration.
member.returns: The options builder so that further configuration can be chained.

member.name: T:Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.InMemoryDatabaseRoot
member.summary: Acts as a root for all in-memory databases such that they will be available across context instances and service providers as long as the same instance of this type is passed to

summary.para: This API supports the Entity Framework Core infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. This API may change or be removed in future releases.
Entity Framework code will set this instance as needed. It should be considered opaque to application code; the type of object may change at any time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.InMemoryServiceCollectionExtensions
member.summary: In-memory specific extension methods for .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.InMemoryServiceCollectionExtensions.AddEntityFrameworkInMemoryDatabase(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)

summary.para: Adds the services required by the in-memory database provider for Entity Framework to an . You use this method when using dependency injection in your application, such as with ASP.NET. For more information on setting up dependency injection, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=526890.

You only need to use this functionality when you want Entity Framework to resolve the services it uses from an external dependency injection container. If you are not using an external dependency injection container, Entity Framework will take care of creating the services it requires.

member.param: The to add services to.
member.returns: The same service collection so that multiple calls can be chained.
